meanings.definition: To put a new jacket on something.
meanings.sent1: She decided to rejacket her favorite book to protect it.
meanings.sent2: The tailor will rejacket the coat with a stylish design.
meanings.sent3: He tried to rejacket his old phone in a sock for fun.
meanings.sent4: The forest seemed to rejacket itself in vibrant colors in the fall.
meanings.sent5: The students were excited to rejacket their notebooks with colorful covers.

meanings.definition: To cover or wrap something with a new jacket.
meanings.sent1: The librarian will rejacket the damaged book to keep it safe.
meanings.sent2: They decided to rejacket the gift in shiny wrapping paper.
meanings.sent3: She tried to rejacket the cat in a tiny sweater, but it wriggled free.
meanings.sent4: The snow seemed to rejacket the town in a blanket of white.
meanings.sent5: The chef will rejacket the dish with a sprinkle of fresh herbs.

meanings.definition: To replace the jacket on something.
meanings.sent1: It was time to rejacket the worn-out sofa with a new cover.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic will rejacket the engine with a stronger casing.
meanings.sent3: He decided to rejacket his phone with a sturdier case after dropping it.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to rejacket the landscape in a layer of snow.
meanings.sent5: She will rejacket the old photo album with a new, protective sleeve.
